channel.title: Times of India
channel.description: The Times of India: Breaking news, views, reviews, cricket from across India
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) 2023 Bennett Coleman Co. Ltd, http://info.indiatimes.com/terms/tou.html

item.title: Don-turned-politician Anand Mohan Singh released from Bihar's Saharsa jail
item.description: Don-turned-politician Anand Mohan Singh was released from a Bihar prison around 4.30am on Thursday. Singh, a former MLA and Lok Sabha MP, was convicted for the murder of the then Gopalganj district magistrate G Krishnaiah. Opposition parties in Bihar have strongly objected to Anand Mohan's release of Singh.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: With security focus on ‘core’ areas, Dantewada was Maoist soft target
item.description: Maoists on Wednesday blew up a vehicle carrying 10 personnel of the District Reserve Guard in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada, which is not quite their ‘core’ area and has seen few attacks since the ambush of 2010 that killed 75 CRPF jawans. They avoided strongholds like Sukma or Bijapur, where CRPF has been making deep inroads and setting up forward operating bases (FOBs).
item.dc:creator: BHARTI JAIN

item.title: 'Nod to same-­sex marriage to ruin Special Marriage Act’s intent'
item.description: The Union government told the Supreme Court on Wednesday that recognising LGBTQIA+ community members’ marriage rights would destroy the legislative intent to permit only man-woman marriage under the Special Marriage Act and pointed out that the court neither had the wherewithal to gauge who among them were males or females nor the competence to create a regulatory framework for same-sex marriages.
item.dc:creator: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA

item.title: Relief, and Ram chants, as 367 from Sudan land in Delhi
item.description: As many as 367 passengers arrived at Delhi airport on a special flight from Jeddah under Operation Kaveri, the Saudi port city where they had arrived from Port Sudan. Sudan is witnessing intense clashes between military and main parliamentary forces. After the flight landed at 9.11pm, many passengers exited chanting “Jai Shri Ram”.
item.dc:creator: PRIYANGI AGARWAL

item.title: 'Donald Trump raped me': Writer tells jury in lawsuit trial
item.description: As she took the stand to give testimony that sometimes brought her to tears, Trump, from afar, repeated his insistence that Carroll’s claim of a 1996 rape is utter fiction. He called the case “a made-up scam,” and more.
item.dc:creator: AP

item.title: Need initial probe before FIR against WFI chief: Cops
item.description: The Delhi Police on Wednesday informed the Supreme Court that it was ready to register an FIR, based on the sexual harassment complaint filed by seven national-level women wrestlers, against Wrestling Federation of India president and BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: 'Palace' renovation shows Kejriwal's 'lust for luxury', says BJP
item.description: Lashing out at the expenditure of over Rs 45 crore on renovation of Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence, BJP on Wednesday alleged that such a big sum was a pointer to the ideological "renovation" of the AAP founder who had entered politics promising simplicity and honesty.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Singapore hangs Indian-origin man over 1 kg of cannabis
item.description: Singapore on Wednesday executed a 46-year-old Indian-origin drug trafficker, ignoring pleas for clemency from his family, human rights activists and the UN. Tangaraju Suppiah was hanged at dawn in Changi Prison, aday after his 11th-hour appeal was rejected by a court here. The 46-year-old was sentenced in 2018 for coordinating with two other men to import 1kg of cannabis in 2013. Although he never came into contact with the drug, he was sentenced to death by hanging.
item.dc:creator: Agencies

item.title: Muslim quota ammo in Yogi, Rajnath hands to target Congress
item.description: Congress’s stock-in-trade may be appeasement but the Constitution doesn’t permit rolling out religion-based reservation for votes, defence minister Rajnath Singh and UP CM Yogi Adityanath said at separate rallies in Karnataka on Wednesday as BJP’s star campaigners kept their focus fixed on the 4% quota for Muslims that the state scrapped recently.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: 'Default bail accused's right, can't be denied if probe incomplete'
item.dc:creator: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY

item.title: Virat Kohli after RCB's defeat: 'We deserved to lose'
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore were left to lick their wounds after a 21-run defeat against Kolkata Knight Riders at home on Wednesday in the Indian Premier League after a poor show in the field to let the opposition off the hook, followed by some soft dismissals in run-chase.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: 'Operation Kaveri': INS Teg departs from Sudan with 297 passengers
item.description: The fifth batch of 297 stranded Indians departed from Port Sudan for Jeddah in Saudi Arabia by INS Teg on Thursday. "#OperationKaveri INS Teg departs from Port Sudan with 297 passengers. This is the fifth batch of stranded Indians enroute to Jeddah," Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi tweeted.
item.dc:creator: ANI

item.title: Amit Shah launches first liquid Nano DAP to cut fertiliser import bill
item.description: Union home and cooperation minister Amit Shah on Wednesday launched the world’s first liquid Nano DAP — a novel nano fertiliser containing nitrogen and phosphorus — whose use will not only reduce India’s fertiliser import dependence but also take the country towards sustainable farming and increase the farmers’ income by bringing down input cost.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Mann Ki Baat focused on issues, not partisan politics: Shah
item.description: Ahead of the 100th episode of PM Narendra Modi’s Mann Ki Baat on April 30, a day-long conclave in Delhi underlined the deep, positive impact of the programme on society. While Vice President Dhankhar said the 100th episode will lay the foundations of ‘India at 100’, Union home minister Amit Shah lauded PM Modi’s initiative for connecting the youth with Aakashvaani, strengthening the foundations of democracy through dialogue, and achieving all this without once dwelling on partisan politics.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Gujarat HC judge recuses herself from hearing Rahul's case
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Cabinet approves 157 nursing colleges with almost 100 seats each
item.description: India will soon have 157 new nursing colleges with approximately 100 seats each. A decision in this regard was taken in the meeting of the Cabinet committee on economic affairs, chaired by PM Narendra Modi. The new nursing colleges will be established in co-location with the existing medical colleges established since 2014. UP will have the maximum 27 such medical colleges, followed by Rajasthan (23) and Madhya Pradesh (14).
item.dc:creator: DURGESH NANDAN JHA

item.title: Supreme Court eases no-­construction rule near national parks
item.description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday permitted forest dwellers to legitimately continue with their traditional activities, farming, construction of houses and schools within the eco-sensitive zones (ESZs) of national parks and wildlife sanctuaries. The top court modified its year-old order banning all activities within a 1-km periphery of national parks and sanctuaries on an application from the Union government.
item.dc:creator: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA

item.title: Tax relief on builder-paid rent in redevelopment projects
item.description: The Income-Tax Appellate Tribunal’s (ITAT) Mumbai bench recently held that the rental compensation received from a builder due to a redevelopment project is not taxable in the hands of the former flat owner. ITAT adopted this stand even as the taxpayer, the former flat owner, had not taken another accommodation on rent but had moved in with his parents.
item.dc:creator: LUBNA KABLY

item.title: High court allows Bengaluru couple who lost son to seek surrogacy
item.description: The Karnataka high court has come to the aid of a Bengaluru couple who had lost their only son in an accident in Mangaluru last year, allowing them to take the surrogacy route to have another child after they pass a triple test on economic, genetic and physical well-being parameters.
item.dc:creator: VASANTHA KUMAR

item.title: 1st woman Rafale pilot in IAF team for multi-nation drill being held in France
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: 8 months after Anubrata arrest, daughter held by ED in Delhi
item.description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Sukanya Mondal, daughter of Trinamool leader Anubrata Mondal, in Delhi on Wednesday on money-laundering charges in connection with the cattle smuggling scam.
item.dc:creator: ROHIT KHANNA

item.title: 50kg explosives used in Maoist IED blast in Dantewada
item.description: At least 10 personnel of the District Reserve Guards (DRG) and their civilian driver were killed when Maoists detonated a powerful IED on a kuchha road and fired on the wounded jawans near Aranpur in Dantewada district of Bastar, about 400km south of Raipur, on Wednesday. Around 200 jawans were returning in a convoy when the blast was triggered around 1.30pm. Police believe 50kg of explosives was used.
item.dc:creator: RASHMI DROLIA

item.title: Ayurved docs not entitled to same salary as MBBS counterparts: SC
item.description: Observing that the nature of duties and responsibilities of MBBS and ayurved doctors are quite different, the Supreme Court on Wednesday held that practitioners of the alternative system of medicine, who do not attend emergency duty and perform complicated surgery, are not entitled to equal salary to that of their allopathic counterparts.
item.dc:creator: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY

item.title: Armed man storms into Bengal school, holds students, teacher hostage
item.description: A gunman, brandishing a 9mm pistol, two bottles of acid and with a knife tied to his ankle, stormed into a government school in Malda on Wednesday morning and held 80 Class VII pupils and their teacher hostage for nearly an hour before an unarmed police officer was able to overpower him and take him into custody.
item.dc:creator: SUBHRO MAITRA

item.title: Why last leg of K'taka campaigning is vital for BJP
item.description: While both BJP and Congress are optimistic about their prospects in the May 10 elections, both national parties are hoping to turn the tide completely in their favour in the last leg of campaigning. BJP is banking on the popularity of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union home minister Amit Shah, who has already launched an aggressive campaign in the state.
item.dc:creator: MANUAIYAPPA KANATHANDA

item.title: IPL: KKR back to winning ways with 21-run win over RCB
item.description: Kolkata Knight Riders snapped their four-match losing streak with a comfortable 21-run victory over Royal Challengers Bangalore in the reverse fixture of the IPL 2023 played at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: How Russia-Ukraine war spurred military expenditure in 2022
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: WATCH: Iyer takes a stunning catch to get rid of Kohli
item.description: Catches win matches is an age-old saying but it matters the most when you grab something extraordinary to take out the big fish and the same thing happened on Wednesday when Kolkata Knight Riders' Venkatesh Iyer took an outstanding catch to get rid of Royal Challengers Bangalore's stand-in skipper Virat Kohli in an IPL match at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: 'ISIS drug' smuggled to war-torn Sudan from India
item.description: Tramadol, the pain-relieving opiate that was notoriously used by ISIS fighters to stay awake for long hours, may have been illegally exported from manufacturers in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh to war-torn countries, including Sudan.
item.dc:creator: U SUDHAKAR REDDY

item.title: Dalai Lama gets Ramon Magsaysay Award in person after 64yrs
item.description: The Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama was presented with the 1959 Ramon Magsaysay Award after 64 years on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ANAND BODH

item.title: Indian nationals evacuated from Sudan narrate ordeal
item.description: Amid the 72-hour ceasefire that has been agreed upon by the two warring factions in Sudan, countries have been evacuating their citizens at the speed of light, India being one to recently evacuate its nationals under Operation Kaveri. The Indian Air Force very recently rescued another batch of around 250 trapped Indians from conflict-torn Sudan as part of the rescue effort.
item.dc:creator: ANI

item.title: Last respects to Parkash Singh Badal: Who said what
item.description: People queue up to pay their last respect to the five-time chief minister of Punjab and the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) patriarch Parkash Singh Badal at SAD headquarters in Chandigarh's Sector 28 on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: SANJEEV VERMA

item.title: Jaishankar slams Pak on terror, Bhutto meet unlikely
item.description: Jaishankar’s condemnation of Pakistan’s use of cross-border terrorism, days after the attack on an army convoy in J&K that left five Indian soldiers dead, is being seen as an indication that a formal bilateral meeting with Bilawal on the margins of SCO is improbable. The possibility of a courtesy meeting between the two isn’t entirely ruled out, given that India is the host, but government sources said a 'structured' bilateral is unlikely.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Airlines saving lakhs a year on ‘denied boarding’ payout
item.dc:creator: MANJU V

item.title: Archer lambasts English daily for 'putting out an article'
item.description: England fast bowler Jofra Archer on Wednesday lambasted English daily for putting out an article without knowing the facts and termed it crazy as no consent was taken from him for the published article.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: Man steals phone of GF’s dad, dials 112 to threaten Yogi; held
item.description: The Commissionerate police on Tuesday arrested a person who issued death threats to Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on the dial 112 helpline service. Identified as Amin, alias Chotu, resident of Begumpurwa of Babupurwa police station area, the man dialed 112 and threatened to kill the Chief Minister in a conspiracy to settle scores with the father of his alleged girlfriend.
item.dc:creator: FAIZ RAHMAN SIDDIQUI

item.title: Maruti Suzuki to launch Toyota-based 7-seat hybrid SUV soon
item.description: Maruti Suzuki India Ltd. (MSIL) has revealed that it is all set to launch a brand-new 7-seat hybrid SUV in the Indian market in the coming months.
item.dc:creator: SAHIL KUKREJA
